Url.Title: Welcome
Url.Abstract: Welcome to the DB Distributor eCommerce Toolkit Online Help. While you're working in DB Distributor's eCommerce Toolkit, you can press the F1 key at any time to access the online help for the currently displayed panel or tab. Use the following toolbar buttons to navigate this help system: Home ...

Url.Title: About eCommerce
Url.Abstract: About eCommerce DB Distributor's eCommerce toolkit is used for setting up your customers and their items to be sold on the Internet. This includes setting up buyers, product catalogs, and servers.

Url.Title: eCommerce Setup
Url.Abstract: eCommerce Setup The setup of the eCommerce module primarily consists of setting up your system parameters, customer parameters, items parameters, and buyers. You will also need to do additional setup involving system setup and other supporting files. Select a link to learn more about a ...

Url.Title: 1099 Processing
Url.Abstract: How to Process 1099's In your Accounts Payable parameters, you will need to set the "Is there 1099 processing" to "yes", and also enter in the current calendar year for 1099 processing. In the Current Status area of the Vendor Setup , you must have a 1099 type set for the vendor. Under the main ...

Url.Title: Credit Card Payments
Url.Abstract: How to Pay Vendors with a Credit Card Since credit card purchases have become more common, we have setup a procedure to better handle credit card purchases; rather than making many manual adjustments. You will want to follow these steps: You will want to setup a new general ledger account near ...

Url.Title: Invoice Adjustments
Url.Abstract: How to Enter an Adjustment for an Existing Open Invoice As always, in order to minimize the amount of adjustments that you would need to make, we would recommend that you check your Purchase Journal for any errors before updating and creating your invoices. However, there are situations when you ...

Url.Title: Accounts Payable
Url.Abstract: - How To... This section provides instructions for addressing the following Accounts Payable Special Situations: How to Adjust a Previously Entered Invoice How to Enter a Prepayment to a Vendor How to Pay a Vendor with a Credit Card How to Change an Invoice to a Different Period How to Correct ...

Url.Title: Check Period Change
Url.Abstract: How to Correct Checks Updated to the Wrong Period Month end is a time when you need to be aware of what period your checks are being posted to. If a new month has started, but you have yet to close out the previous period, you will want to make sure that new checks get put into the next period. ...

Url.Title: Invoice Period Change
Url.Abstract: How to Correct an Invoice Entered Into the Wrong Period Month end is a time when you need to be aware of what period your invoices are being posted to. If a new month has started, but you have yet to close out the previous period, you will want to make sure that new invoices get put into the next ...

Url.Title: Prepay
Url.Abstract: How to Enter a Prepayment to a Vendor In Manual Check Entry , you will want to create either a handwritten or print check. After setting up the check, you will need to enter in an invoice number. Since you have not yet received a vendor invoice, we would typically recommend that you setup the ...

Url.Title: AP Reconciliation
Url.Abstract:
How to Reconcile Your AP at Month End Make sure that you have updated all Purchase Journals and Disbursement Batches that you may have in process and update your General Ledger Detail Transaction.
The first step in this process is to print out the AP Trial Balance for the period. Then print ...
